page.title: 09The Hedgerows nr. Staverton
page.content: The farmers are trying to keep the ancient banks and hedges that separate the fields,but we have noticed the area around Abham has been turned into four large{fields}where some ten were before.This issue has been discussed by the parish council and the owner maintains that changing from mixed farming to cereal growing means that room must be made for machines to operate efficiently. We hope this won't affect too much of the countryside as so many creatures that we are learning about live in the hedges.We have also found from our Hooper's hedge study that many are more than 500 years old. All of us recorded the {flowers}of the{hedgerow}that we could find and could not believe there were 206 different species.
